strapiPost.title: Anthony Timberlands Center Featured By Architectural Record
strapiPost.content:
Architectural Record recently featured a list of projects around the world that demonstrate unique uses of wood, including The Anthony Timberlands Center for Design and Materials Innovation — currently under construction at the University of Arkansas.

  • Ark-Irish: In collaboration with Modus Studio, the project is the first U.S. build and the first timber build for Pritzker Prize–winning firm Grafton Architects of Dublin. Using Arkansas-sourced timber, the $26.5m building will include a high-bay fabrication workshop, studios, conference rooms, faculty offices, and outdoor terraces.
  • Cool school: As part of the Fay Jones School of Architecture and Design, the center will be home to the school’s growing design-build program and fabrication technologies laboratories and will house the school’s emerging graduate program in timber and wood design.
